controls.title: Limit information system access to authorized users
controls.practice: Limit information system access to authorized users, processes acting on behalf of authorized users, or devices (including other information systems).
controls.guidance: Implement user authentication and access control mechanisms. Ensure only authorized users can access systems.
controls.assessmentQuestion: How do you control who can access your information systems?

controls.title: Limit information system access to authorized functions
controls.practice: Limit information system access to the types of transactions and functions that authorized users are permitted to execute.
controls.guidance: Implement role-based access control (RBAC). Users should only access functions necessary for their job.
controls.assessmentQuestion: How do you ensure users only access the functions they need?

controls.title: Verify and control external connections
controls.practice: Verify and control/limit connections to and use of external information systems.
controls.guidance: Monitor and control connections to external systems. Implement firewalls and network access controls.
controls.assessmentQuestion: How do you control connections to external systems?

controls.title: Control information posted on publicly accessible systems
controls.practice: Control information posted or processed on publicly accessible information systems.
controls.guidance: Implement processes to review and approve information before posting to public systems.
controls.assessmentQuestion: How do you control what information is posted publicly?

controls.title: Identify information system users
controls.practice: Identify information system users, processes acting on behalf of users, or devices.
controls.guidance: Implement unique user identification. Each user must have a unique identifier.
controls.assessmentQuestion: How do you uniquely identify each user in your systems?

controls.title: Authenticate users, processes, and devices
controls.practice: Authenticate (or verify) the identities of those users, processes, or devices, as a prerequisite to allowing access to organizational information systems.
controls.guidance: Implement authentication mechanisms such as passwords, biometrics, or tokens.
controls.assessmentQuestion: How do you verify the identity of users before granting access?

controls.title: Sanitize or destroy information system media
controls.practice: Sanitize or destroy information system media containing Federal Contract Information before disposal or release for reuse.
controls.guidance: Implement secure media disposal procedures. Use approved sanitization methods.
controls.assessmentQuestion: How do you securely dispose of media containing sensitive information?

controls.title: Limit physical access to organizational information systems
controls.practice: Limit physical access to organizational information systems, equipment, and the respective operating environments to authorized individuals.
controls.guidance: Implement physical access controls such as locks, badges, and visitor logs.
controls.assessmentQuestion: How do you control who can physically access your systems?

controls.title: Escort visitors and monitor visitor activity
controls.practice: Escort visitors and monitor visitor activity; maintain audit logs of physical access; and control and manage physical access devices.
controls.guidance: Implement visitor management procedures. Maintain visitor logs and escort requirements.
controls.assessmentQuestion: How do you manage and monitor visitors to your facilities?

controls.title: Monitor and control communications at external boundaries
controls.practice: Monitor, control, and protect organizational communications (i.e., information transmitted or received by organizational information systems) at the external boundaries and key internal boundaries of the information systems.
controls.guidance: Implement boundary protection devices such as firewalls and intrusion detection systems.
controls.assessmentQuestion: How do you monitor and control network communications?

controls.title: Implement subnetworks for publicly accessible system components
controls.practice: Implement subnetworks for publicly accessible system components that are physically or logically separated from internal networks.
controls.guidance: Implement DMZ or separate networks for public-facing systems.
controls.assessmentQuestion: How are your public-facing systems separated from internal networks?

controls.title: Identify and manage information system flaws
controls.practice: Identify, report, and correct information and information system flaws in a timely manner.
controls.guidance: Implement vulnerability management and patch management processes.
controls.assessmentQuestion: How do you identify and fix system vulnerabilities?

controls.title: Provide protection from malicious code
controls.practice: Provide protection from malicious code at appropriate locations within organizational information systems.
controls.guidance: Implement antivirus/antimalware solutions on all endpoints and servers.
controls.assessmentQuestion: How do you protect systems from malware and viruses?

controls.title: Update malicious code protection mechanisms
controls.practice: Update malicious code protection mechanisms when new releases are available.
controls.guidance: Ensure antivirus definitions are updated regularly and automatically.
controls.assessmentQuestion: How do you keep your malware protection up to date?

controls.title: Perform periodic scans and real-time scans
controls.practice: Perform periodic scans of the information system and real-time scans of files from external sources as files are downloaded, opened, or executed.
controls.guidance: Configure regular scheduled scans and real-time protection on all systems.
controls.assessmentQuestion: How often do you scan systems for malware?

controls.title: Security Awareness Training
controls.practice: Ensure that personnel are trained on security awareness and responsibilities.
controls.guidance: Provide security awareness training to all personnel handling CUI.
controls.assessmentQuestion: How do you train your personnel on security awareness?

controls.title: Establish and maintain baseline configurations
controls.practice: Establish and maintain baseline configurations and inventories of organizational systems.
controls.guidance: Document standard configurations and maintain an inventory of all systems.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Do you have documented baseline configurations for your systems?

2.name: Advanced
2.description: Advanced cybersecurity practices - NIST SP 800-171 Rev 2

controls.title: Provide privacy and security notices
controls.practice: Provide privacy and security notices consistent with applicable CUI rules.
controls.guidance: Create and display privacy and security notices on systems that process CUI.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Do you have privacy and security notices on systems processing CUI?

controls.title: Implement separation of duties
controls.practice: Enforce separation of duties through assigned access authorizations.
controls.guidance: Ensure no single person can compromise security controls.
controls.assessmentQuestion: How do you implement separation of duties?

controls.title: Employ least privilege
controls.practice: Employ the principle of least privilege, including for specific security functions and privileged accounts.
controls.guidance: Grant users only the minimum access necessary to perform their duties.
controls.assessmentQuestion: How do you implement least privilege access?

controls.title: Use non-privileged accounts
controls.practice: Use non-privileged accounts or roles when accessing nonsecurity functions.
controls.guidance: Ensure users use non-privileged accounts for routine activities.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Do users have separate privileged and non-privileged accounts?

controls.title: Disable inactive accounts
controls.practice: Terminate (automatically) a user session after a defined condition.
controls.guidance: Implement automatic session termination after inactivity.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Do sessions automatically lock after inactivity?

controls.title: Use session lock
controls.practice: Use session lock with pattern-hiding displays to prevent access and viewing of data after a period of inactivity.
controls.guidance: Configure screen lock after 15 minutes of inactivity.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Are systems configured to lock after inactivity?

controls.title: Authorize wireless access
controls.practice: Authorize wireless access prior to allowing such connections.
controls.guidance: Implement wireless access controls and approval processes.
controls.assessmentQuestion: How do you authorize wireless network access?

controls.title: Monitor and control remote access
controls.practice: Monitor and control remote access sessions.
controls.guidance: Implement remote access monitoring and logging.
controls.assessmentQuestion: How do you monitor remote access to your systems?

controls.title: Employ cryptographic mechanisms
controls.practice: Employ cryptographic mechanisms to protect the confidentiality of remote access sessions.
controls.guidance: Use VPN or other encryption for remote access.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Is remote access encrypted?

controls.title: Route remote access via managed access control points
controls.practice: Route remote access via managed access control points.
controls.guidance: All remote access should go through designated gateways.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Is remote access routed through controlled access points?

controls.title: Authorize remote execution
controls.practice: Authorize remote execution of privileged commands and remote access to security-relevant information.
controls.guidance: Require approval for remote execution of privileged commands.
controls.assessmentQuestion: How do you authorize remote privileged access?

controls.title: Control the use of mobile code
controls.practice: Control the use of mobile code.
controls.guidance: Implement controls for scripts and mobile code execution.
controls.assessmentQuestion: How do you control mobile code and scripts?

controls.title: Control the use of portable storage
controls.practice: Control the use of portable storage devices.
controls.guidance: Restrict or monitor use of USB drives and portable storage.
controls.assessmentQuestion: How do you control portable storage devices?

controls.title: Provide security awareness training
controls.practice: Ensure that managers, systems administrators, and users of organizational systems are made aware of the security risks associated with their activities and of the applicable policies, standards, and procedures related to the security of those systems.
controls.guidance: Provide annual security awareness training to all personnel.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Do all personnel receive security awareness training?

controls.title: Provide role-based security training
controls.practice: Ensure that personnel are trained to carry out their assigned information security-related duties and responsibilities.
controls.guidance: Provide role-specific security training.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Do personnel receive role-based security training?

controls.title: Provide security training updates
controls.practice: Provide security awareness training on recognizing and reporting potential indicators of insider threat.
controls.guidance: Include insider threat awareness in training.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Does training cover insider threat indicators?

controls.title: Create and retain audit logs
controls.practice: Create, protect, and retain information system audit records to the extent needed to enable monitoring, analysis, investigation, and reporting of unlawful, unauthorized, or inappropriate information system activity.
controls.guidance: Enable audit logging on all systems processing CUI.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Do you retain audit logs for systems with CUI?

controls.title: Ensure actions can be traced to users
controls.practice: Ensure that the actions of individual system users can be uniquely traced to those users so they can be held accountable for their actions.
controls.guidance: Audit logs must include user identification.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Can user actions be traced in audit logs?

controls.title: Review audit logs
controls.practice: Review and update logged events.
controls.guidance: Regularly review what events are being logged.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Do you review what events are logged?

controls.title: Alert on audit failure
controls.practice: Alert in the event of an audit logging process failure.
controls.guidance: Configure alerts when audit logging fails.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Are administrators alerted when logging fails?

controls.title: Provide audit reduction capability
controls.practice: Provide a system capability that compares and synchronizes internal system clocks with an authoritative source to generate time stamps for audit records.
controls.guidance: Synchronize system clocks with authoritative time sources.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Are system clocks synchronized with an authoritative source?

controls.title: Protect audit information
controls.practice: Protect audit information and audit logging tools from unauthorized access, modification, and deletion.
controls.guidance: Restrict access to audit logs and protect their integrity.
controls.assessmentQuestion: How do you protect audit logs from unauthorized access?

controls.title: Limit audit log management
controls.practice: Limit management of audit logging functionality to a subset of privileged users.
controls.guidance: Only authorized administrators can manage audit logging.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Who can manage audit logging configurations?

controls.title: Develop and implement a system security plan
controls.practice: Develop, document, and periodically update system security plans that describe system boundaries, system environments of operation, how security requirements are implemented, and the relationships with or connections to other systems.
controls.guidance: Create and maintain a System Security Plan (SSP).
controls.assessmentQuestion: Do you have a documented System Security Plan?

controls.title: Conduct security assessments
controls.practice: Periodically assess the security controls in organizational systems to determine if the controls are effective in their application.
controls.guidance: Conduct annual security control assessments.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Do you periodically assess security controls?

controls.title: Develop and implement plans of action
controls.practice: Develop and implement plans of action designed to correct deficiencies and reduce or eliminate vulnerabilities in organizational systems.
controls.guidance: Create Plans of Action and Milestones (POA&M) for deficiencies.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Do you have POA&Ms for identified deficiencies?

controls.title: Perform security assessments of new systems
controls.practice: Monitor security controls on an ongoing basis to ensure the continued effectiveness of the controls.
controls.guidance: Implement continuous monitoring of security controls.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Do you continuously monitor security controls?

controls.title: Employ system monitoring tools
controls.practice: Employ system monitoring tools and techniques to detect attacks and indicators of potential attacks.
controls.guidance: Use SIEM, IDS/IPS, or other monitoring tools.
controls.assessmentQuestion: What tools do you use to monitor for attacks?

controls.title: Establish baseline configurations
controls.practice: Establish and maintain baseline configurations and inventories of organizational systems (including hardware, software, firmware, and documentation) throughout the respective system development life cycles.
controls.guidance: Document and maintain baseline configurations for all systems.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Do you have documented baseline configurations?

controls.title: Employ the principle of least functionality
controls.practice: Employ the principle of least functionality by configuring organizational systems to provide only essential capabilities.
controls.guidance: Disable unnecessary services and features.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Do you disable unnecessary services and ports?

controls.title: Control and monitor user-installed software
controls.practice: Control and monitor user-installed software.
controls.guidance: Implement application whitelisting or software restrictions.
controls.assessmentQuestion: How do you control software installation by users?

controls.title: Enforce security by configuration
controls.practice: Enforce a security configuration management policy.
controls.guidance: Document and enforce security configuration standards.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Do you have a configuration management policy?

controls.title: Track, review, and approve changes
controls.practice: Track, review, approve/disapprove, and audit changes to organizational systems.
controls.guidance: Implement change management processes.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Do you have a change management process?

controls.title: Analyze security impact of changes
controls.practice: Analyze the security impact of changes prior to implementation.
controls.guidance: Assess security impact before implementing changes.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Do you analyze security impacts before making changes?

controls.title: Enforce minimum password complexity
controls.practice: Enforce a minimum password complexity and change of characters when new passwords are created.
controls.guidance: Implement password complexity requirements (length, character types).
controls.assessmentQuestion: What are your password complexity requirements?

controls.title: Prohibit password reuse
controls.practice: Prohibit password reuse for a specified number of generations.
controls.guidance: Prevent reuse of recent passwords (e.g., last 5-10 passwords).
controls.assessmentQuestion: Do you prohibit password reuse?

controls.title: Store passwords using approved techniques
controls.practice: Allow temporary password use for system logons with an immediate change to a permanent password.
controls.guidance: Temporary passwords must be changed on first use.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Are temporary passwords changed on first use?

controls.title: Store and transmit only encrypted passwords
controls.practice: Store and transmit only cryptographically-protected passwords.
controls.guidance: Use encryption for password storage and transmission.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Are passwords encrypted in storage and transit?

controls.title: Obscure feedback of authentication information
controls.practice: Obscure feedback of authentication information.
controls.guidance: Password fields should display asterisks or dots.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Is password feedback obscured during entry?

controls.title: Enforce password minimum and maximum lifetime
controls.practice: Enforce minimum and maximum password lifetime restrictions.
controls.guidance: Set password expiration (e.g., 60-90 days) and minimum age.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Do passwords expire periodically?

controls.title: Disable identifiers after 35 days of inactivity
controls.practice: Disable identifiers after 35 days of inactivity.
controls.guidance: Automatically disable accounts inactive for 35 days.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Are inactive accounts disabled automatically?

controls.title: Use multifactor authentication
controls.practice: Use multifactor authentication for local and network access to privileged accounts and for network access to non-privileged accounts.
controls.guidance: Implement MFA for privileged accounts and remote access.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Do you use MFA for privileged and remote access?

controls.title: Prevent reuse of identifiers
controls.practice: Prevent reuse of identifiers for a defined period.
controls.guidance: Don't reuse usernames for a specified period.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Do you prevent username reuse?

controls.title: Disable identifiers after maximum number of failed attempts
controls.practice: Disable identifiers after a defined number of invalid login attempts.
controls.guidance: Lock accounts after failed login attempts (e.g., 5 attempts).
controls.assessmentQuestion: Do accounts lock after failed login attempts?

controls.title: Employ replay-resistant authentication
controls.practice: Employ replay-resistant authentication mechanisms for network access to privileged and non-privileged accounts.
controls.guidance: Use Kerberos, certificates, or other replay-resistant methods.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Do you use replay-resistant authentication?

controls.title: Establish incident response capability
controls.practice: Establish an operational incident-handling capability for organizational systems that includes preparation, detection, analysis, containment, recovery, and user response activities.
controls.guidance: Create an Incident Response Plan.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Do you have an Incident Response Plan?

controls.title: Detect and report events
controls.practice: Detect, report, and respond to information system security incidents.
controls.guidance: Implement incident detection and reporting procedures.
controls.assessmentQuestion: How do you detect and report security incidents?

controls.title: Track and document incidents
controls.practice: Track, document, and report incidents to designated officials and/or authorities both internal and external to the organization.
controls.guidance: Maintain incident tracking and documentation.
controls.assessmentQuestion: How do you track and document incidents?

controls.title: Test incident response capability
controls.practice: Test the organizational incident response capability.
controls.guidance: Conduct incident response exercises or tabletops.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Do you test your incident response procedures?

controls.title: Perform maintenance on systems
controls.practice: Perform maintenance on organizational systems.
controls.guidance: Maintain systems according to vendor recommendations.
controls.assessmentQuestion: How do you perform system maintenance?

controls.title: Control maintenance tools and personnel
controls.practice: Provide controls on the tools, techniques, mechanisms, and personnel used to conduct system maintenance.
controls.guidance: Control who can perform maintenance and with what tools.
controls.assessmentQuestion: How do you control system maintenance activities?

controls.title: Require multifactor authentication for remote maintenance
controls.practice: Require multifactor authentication to establish nonlocal maintenance sessions via external network connections and terminate such connections when nonlocal maintenance is complete.
controls.guidance: Use MFA for remote maintenance access.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Is MFA required for remote maintenance?

controls.title: Supervise maintenance activities
controls.practice: Supervise the maintenance activities of maintenance personnel without required access authorization.
controls.guidance: Escort and supervise unauthorized maintenance personnel.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Are unauthorized maintenance personnel supervised?

controls.title: Protect and control CUI media
controls.practice: Protect (i.e., physically control and securely store) system media containing CUI, both paper and digital.
controls.guidance: Implement physical and logical protections for media with CUI.
controls.assessmentQuestion: How do you protect media containing CUI?

controls.title: Limit access to CUI on media
controls.practice: Limit access to CUI on system media to authorized users.
controls.guidance: Restrict access to media containing CUI to authorized individuals.
controls.assessmentQuestion: How do you limit access to CUI media?

controls.title: Control media during transport
controls.practice: Control the use of removable media on system components.
controls.guidance: Restrict or disable removable media use.
controls.assessmentQuestion: How do you control removable media?

controls.title: Mark media with CUI markings
controls.practice: Mark media with necessary CUI markings and distribution limitations.
controls.guidance: Label media containing CUI appropriately.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Do you mark media containing CUI?

controls.title: Prohibit public posting of CUI
controls.practice: Control access to media containing CUI and maintain accountability for media during transport outside of controlled areas.
controls.guidance: Track media when it leaves controlled areas.
controls.assessmentQuestion: How do you control media during transport?

controls.title: Implement cryptographic protection for CUI at rest
controls.practice: Implement cryptographic mechanisms to protect the confidentiality of CUI stored on digital media during transport unless otherwise protected by alternative physical safeguards.
controls.guidance: Encrypt portable media containing CUI.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Is CUI on portable media encrypted?

controls.title: Control access to media during transport
controls.practice: Control access to media containing CUI and maintain accountability for media during transport outside of controlled areas.
controls.guidance: Maintain chain of custody for media in transport.
controls.assessmentQuestion: How do you track media during transport?

controls.title: Protect against physical damage
controls.practice: Limit physical access to organizational information systems, equipment, and the respective operating environments to authorized individuals.
controls.guidance: Implement layered physical security controls.
controls.assessmentQuestion: What physical security controls protect your systems?

controls.title: Protect systems from environmental hazards
controls.practice: Protect and monitor the physical facility and support infrastructure for organizational systems.
controls.guidance: Implement environmental controls and monitoring.
controls.assessmentQuestion: How do you protect against environmental hazards?

controls.title: Employ intrusion detection systems
controls.practice: Employ and maintain fire suppression and detection devices/systems.
controls.guidance: Implement fire protection systems.
controls.assessmentQuestion: What fire protection systems do you have?

controls.title: Enforce safeguarding measures for CUI
controls.practice: Protect and monitor physical access to information system output devices.
controls.guidance: Secure printers and output devices.
controls.assessmentQuestion: How do you protect output devices?

controls.title: Control physical access to network equipment
controls.practice: Maintain audit logs of physical access.
controls.guidance: Keep logs of physical facility access.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Do you maintain physical access logs?

controls.title: Control physical access devices
controls.practice: Control and manage physical access devices.
controls.guidance: Track and manage access badges and keys.
controls.assessmentQuestion: How do you manage physical access devices?

controls.title: Screen individuals prior to authorizing access
controls.practice: Screen individuals prior to authorizing access to organizational systems containing CUI.
controls.guidance: Conduct background checks before granting access.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Do you perform background checks?

controls.title: Ensure protection of CUI during personnel actions
controls.practice: Ensure that organizational systems containing CUI are protected during and after personnel actions such as terminations and transfers.
controls.guidance: Remove access promptly when employees leave.
controls.assessmentQuestion: How do you handle access during personnel changes?

controls.title: Identify and document risks
controls.practice: Periodically assess the risk to organizational operations (including mission, functions, image, or reputation), organizational assets, and individuals, resulting from the operation of organizational systems and the associated processing, storage, or transmission of CUI.
controls.guidance: Conduct annual risk assessments.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Do you perform periodic risk assessments?

controls.title: Scan for vulnerabilities
controls.practice: Scan for vulnerabilities in organizational systems and applications periodically and when new vulnerabilities affecting those systems and applications are identified.
controls.guidance: Conduct regular vulnerability scans.
controls.assessmentQuestion: How often do you scan for vulnerabilities?

controls.title: Remediate vulnerabilities
controls.practice: Remediate vulnerabilities in accordance with assessments of risk.
controls.guidance: Prioritize and remediate vulnerabilities based on risk.
controls.assessmentQuestion: How do you prioritize vulnerability remediation?

controls.title: Employ automated risk assessment tools
controls.practice: Employ threat intelligence as part of the risk assessment process.
controls.guidance: Use threat intelligence feeds in risk assessments.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Do you use threat intelligence?

controls.title: Employ system development life cycle processes
controls.practice: Require that developers and integrators of organizational systems, system components, or services: (i) create and implement a security assessment plan; (ii) perform security assessments.
controls.guidance: Implement secure development lifecycle practices.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Do you have secure development practices?

controls.title: Manage the security of contractor systems
controls.practice: Require the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service to produce a plan that describes the design and implementation details of the security controls employed within the system, system component, or information system service.
controls.guidance: Require security documentation from developers.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Do vendors provide security documentation?

controls.title: Acquire and manage dedicated information security services
controls.practice: Require information system developers/integrators to create and execute a security assessment plan.
controls.guidance: Require security testing before deployment.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Do you test security before system deployment?

controls.title: Define security requirements for contractors
controls.practice: Require the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service to describe the functional properties of the security controls to be employed.
controls.guidance: Specify security requirements in contracts.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Do contracts include security requirements?

controls.title: Implement boundary protection
controls.practice: Monitor, control, and protect organizational communications at the external boundaries and key internal boundaries of the information systems.
controls.guidance: Implement network boundary protection.
controls.assessmentQuestion: How do you protect network boundaries?

controls.title: Implement cryptographic protection
controls.practice: Implement cryptographic mechanisms to prevent unauthorized disclosure of CUI during transmission unless otherwise protected by alternative physical safeguards.
controls.guidance: Encrypt CUI in transit.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Is CUI encrypted during transmission?

controls.title: Terminate network connections
controls.practice: Terminate network connections associated with communications sessions at the end of the sessions or after a defined period of inactivity.
controls.guidance: Configure session timeouts.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Do network sessions timeout automatically?

controls.title: Establish secure defaults
controls.practice: Establish and manage cryptographic keys for cryptography employed in organizational systems.
controls.guidance: Implement key management procedures.
controls.assessmentQuestion: How do you manage encryption keys?

controls.title: Employ architectural designs
controls.practice: Employ FIPS-validated cryptography when used to protect the confidentiality of CUI.
controls.guidance: Use FIPS 140-2 validated encryption.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Do you use FIPS-validated encryption?

controls.title: Prohibit remote activation
controls.practice: Prohibit remote activation of collaborative computing devices and provide indication of devices in use to users present at the device.
controls.guidance: Disable remote activation of cameras/microphones.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Can collaborative devices be remotely activated?

controls.title: Control connection of mobile devices
controls.practice: Control and monitor the use of mobile code.
controls.guidance: Implement controls for mobile code execution.
controls.assessmentQuestion: How do you control mobile code?

controls.title: Control communications at managed interfaces
controls.practice: Control and monitor the use of Voice over Internet Protocol (VoIP) technologies.
controls.guidance: Secure VoIP communications.
controls.assessmentQuestion: How do you secure VoIP communications?

controls.title: Implement cryptographic mechanisms to protect information confidentiality
controls.practice: Implement cryptographic mechanisms to protect the confidentiality of CUI at rest.
controls.guidance: Encrypt CUI at rest.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Is CUI encrypted when stored?

controls.title: Establish information system partitions
controls.practice: Deny network communications traffic by default and allow network communications traffic by exception (i.e., deny all, permit by exception).
controls.guidance: Implement default-deny firewall rules.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Do firewalls deny by default?

controls.title: Prevent information disclosure
controls.practice: Prevent unauthorized and unintended information transfer via shared system resources.
controls.guidance: Implement resource partitioning and clearing.
controls.assessmentQuestion: How do you prevent information leakage via shared resources?

controls.title: Deny communications by default
controls.practice: Implement Domain Name System (DNS) filtering services.
controls.guidance: Use DNS filtering to block malicious domains.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Do you use DNS filtering?

controls.title: Employ domain separation for protection
controls.practice: Implement email authentication technologies.
controls.guidance: Implement SPF, DKIM, and DMARC.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Do you use email authentication (SPF/DKIM/DMARC)?

controls.title: Employ flaw remediation processes
controls.practice: Identify, report, and correct information and information system flaws in a timely manner.
controls.guidance: Implement vulnerability and patch management.
controls.assessmentQuestion: How do you manage system flaws and patches?

controls.title: Provide system monitoring capabilities
controls.practice: Provide protection from malicious code at designated locations within organizational information systems.
controls.guidance: Deploy antimalware on all systems.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Is antimalware deployed on all systems?

controls.title: Monitor system security alerts
controls.practice: Monitor system security alerts and advisories and take action in response.
controls.guidance: Subscribe to and act on security advisories.
controls.assessmentQuestion: How do you monitor security alerts?

controls.title: Identify unauthorized system components
controls.practice: Update malicious code protection mechanisms when new releases are available.
controls.guidance: Keep antimalware updated.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Are antimalware definitions updated regularly?

controls.title: Take corrective action on unauthorized components
controls.practice: Perform periodic scans of the information system and real-time scans of files from external sources as files are downloaded, opened, or executed.
controls.guidance: Configure scheduled and real-time malware scans.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Do you perform regular malware scans?

controls.title: Implement network monitoring
controls.practice: Monitor organizational systems, including inbound and outbound communications traffic, to detect attacks and indicators of potential attacks.
controls.guidance: Implement network monitoring and IDS/IPS.
controls.assessmentQuestion: How do you monitor network traffic?

controls.title: Identify unauthorized software use
controls.practice: Identify unauthorized use of organizational systems.
controls.guidance: Monitor for unauthorized system use.
controls.assessmentQuestion: How do you detect unauthorized system use?

controls.title: Employ spam and phishing protections
controls.practice: Employ spam protection mechanisms at information system access entry and exit points.
controls.guidance: Implement email filtering and anti-spam.
controls.assessmentQuestion: Do you use spam protection?

controls.title: Implement host-based intrusion detection
controls.practice: Implement verification of security functions.
controls.guidance: Verify security controls are functioning correctly.
controls.assessmentQuestion: How do you verify security controls?

controls.title: Employ automated detection tools
controls.practice: Report security incidents to appropriate organizational personnel.
controls.guidance: Define incident reporting procedures.
controls.assessmentQuestion: How are security incidents reported?
